metadata.titleEn: Dataset of Heihe integrated observatory network (automatic weather station of mixed forest station, 2023)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（混合林站自动气象站-2023）
metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Heihe integrated observatory network obtained from the automatic weather station (AWS) at the Sidaoqiao mixed forest station from January 1 to December 31, 2023. The site (101.134° E, 41.990° N) was located on a tamarix and populous forest (Tamarix chinensis Lour. and Populus euphratica Olivier.) surface in the Sidaoqiao, Dalaihubu Town, Ejin Banner, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. The elevation is 874 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (28 m, north), wind speed and direction profile (28 m, north), air pressure (in tamper box), rain gauge (28 m, south), four-component radiometer (24 m, south), two infrared temperature sensors (24 m, south, vertically downward), two photosynthetically active radiation (24 m, south, one vertically upward and one vertically downward), soil heat flux (HFP01; 3 duplicates, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.6, -1.0, -1.6, -2.0, -2.4 m), and soil moisture profile (-0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.6, -1.0, -1.6, -2.0, -2.4 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_28 m; RH_28 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_28 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_28 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), photosynthetically active radiation of upward and downward (PAR_up and PAR_down) (μmol/ (s m^2)), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2 and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_60 cm, Ts_100, Ts_160, Ts_200, Ts_240 cm) (℃), and soil moisture (Ms_2 cm, Ms_4 cm, Ms_10 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_60 cm, Ms_100, Ms_160, Ms_200, Ms_240 cm) (%, volumetric water content).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2023-9-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) and Liu et al. (2023).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2023年1月1日至2023年12月31日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网下游混合林站气象要素观测数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗达来呼布镇四道桥，下垫面是胡杨与柽柳。观测点的经纬度是101.1335E,41.9903N，海拔874m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在28m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在28m处；风速与风向传感器架设在28m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在24m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在24m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；两个光合有效辐射仪安装在24m处，朝向正南，探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm、100cm、160cm、200cm和240cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm、100cm、160cm、200cm和240cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_28m、RH_28m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_28m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_28m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm、Ts_160cm、Ts_200cm、Ts_240cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm、Ms_160cm、Ms_200cm、Ms_240cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_up、PAR_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2023-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称
黑河综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)和Liu et al. (2023)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被前期研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，并支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测，同时还记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站——2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to monitor energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于监测绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集方法的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a data collection method used in oasis–desert ecosystems involves using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer to acquire half-hourly turbulent flux data. Additionally, automatic weather stations are employed to observe hydrometeorological data with a 10-minute average period.
Example.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，数据收集方法的一个例子是使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪来获取半小时的湍流通量数据。此外，自动气象站被用来观察具有10分钟平均周期的水文气象数据。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge that inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing, which may affect data collection efforts?
Example.QuestionCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临的一个挑战是水资源短缺，这可能会影响数据收集工作。
Example.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas, such as the Tarim River basin, face challenges like the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent occurrence of dust storms. These environmental issues can complicate data collection efforts.
Example.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区，如塔里木河流域，面临着河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁发生沙尘暴等挑战。这些环境问题可能会使数据收集工作变得复杂。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset that includes comprehensive observational data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters in arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个包含干旱地区水文气象、植被和土壤参数的综合观测数据集的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: A dataset that includes comprehensive observational data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters can be found in the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin, which consist of energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes, and auxiliary data collected from superstations and ordinary stations since 2012.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个包含全面观测数据的数据库，涵盖了水文气象、植被和土壤参数，位于黑河流域的中下游地区，包括自2012年以来从超级站和普通站收集的能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量及辅助数据。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What characteristics define a comprehensive observational network for monitoring surface processes in arid regions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 定义监测干旱地区表面过程的综合观测网络的特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: automated meteorological stations, air temperature, relative humidity, atmospheric pressure, precipitation, wind speed and direction, radiation components, surface radiation temperature, soil heat flux, soil temperature, soil moisture, sensors positioned at specific heights and depths, rigorous data processing, quality control procedures
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 自动气象站、空气温度、相对湿度、大气压力、降水、风速和风向、辐射分量、地表辐射温度、土壤热通量、土壤温度、土壤湿度、传感器定位在特定高度和深度、严格的数据处理、质量控制程序。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the key features of data quality control processes in meteorological datasets?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 气象数据集的数据质量控制过程的关键特征包括：
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: consistent number of data points per day, specific indicators for missing data, removal of duplicate records, elimination of data exceeding physical or instrumental limits, marking of questionable data, standardized date and time formats
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 每天一致的数据点数量，缺失数据的特定指示符，删除重复记录，消除超过物理或仪器限制的数据，标记可疑数据，标准化日期和时间格式。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What specific attributes are considered when collecting data on soil properties in oasis-desert areas?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在收集绿洲-沙漠地区土壤特性数据时，考虑的具体属性包括：
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: soil temperature at various depths, soil moisture content, soil heat flux
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 土壤不同深度的温度、土壤含水量、土壤热通量

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many data points are expected to be collected daily from the automatic meteorological station in the Heihe River Basin?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 预计每天从黑河流域的自动气象站收集多少个数据点？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many observation stations have been established in the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin since 2012?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，黑河流域中下游地区建立了多少个观测站？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many different soil temperature depths are monitored in the Heihe River Basin meteorological observations?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域气象观测中监测了多少个不同的土壤温度深度？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the meaning of 'comprehensive observation network' in the context of meteorological data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: “综合观测网络”在气象数据收集的背景下指的是一个由多个观测站和设备组成的系统，这些站点和设备共同工作，以收集、监测和分析气象数据，如温度、湿度、风速、降水量等。这种网络能够提供全面、准确的气象信息，帮助气象学家和研究人员进行天气预报和气候研究。
Definition.AnswerEn: A 'comprehensive observation network' in meteorological data collection refers to a system of stations and sensors that gather a wide array of environmental data across different variables and locations. In this context, it includes measurements of air temperature, humidity, soil moisture, radiation, and other climatic factors to provide a holistic understanding of surface processes.
Definition.AnswerCn: “综合观测网络”在气象数据收集中的意义是指一个由多个站点和传感器组成的系统，能够在不同的变量和地点收集广泛的环境数据。在这个背景下，它包括空气温度、湿度、土壤湿度、辐射和其他气候因素的测量，以提供对地表过程的全面理解。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do data collection techniques for soil moisture and temperature in the Heihe River Basin compare to those used in other arid regions?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域的土壤湿度和温度数据收集技术与其他干旱地区使用的技术相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The data collection techniques for soil moisture and temperature in the Heihe River Basin involve embedding soil temperature and moisture probes at various depths up to 240 cm. These methods are similar to those used in other arid regions where soil profiles are critical. However, the specific depths and frequency of data collection (every 10 minutes) may vary compared to other regions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在黑河流域，土壤湿度和温度的数据收集技术涉及将土壤温度和湿度探头嵌入深达240厘米的不同深度。这些方法与其他干旱地区使用的类似，在这些地区，土壤剖面至关重要。然而，具体的深度和数据收集频率（每10分钟一次）可能与其他地区有所不同。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the observed data on air temperature and humidity from an automatic weather station contribute to understanding climate trends in arid and semi-arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 自动气象站观测到的空气温度和湿度数据如何有助于理解干旱和半干旱地区的气候趋势？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The observed data on air temperature and humidity can help identify patterns and changes over time, which are essential for understanding how climate trends are affecting arid and semi-arid regions. Such data can reveal the impact of climate change on oasis–desert systems and inform strategies for sustainable development and ecological balance.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 观察到的空气温度和湿度数据可以帮助识别时间上的模式和变化，这对于理解气候趋势如何影响干旱和半干旱地区至关重要。这些数据可以揭示气候变化对绿洲-沙漠系统的影响，并为可持续发展和生态平衡的策略提供信息。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What can the patterns in soil temperature and moisture data reveal about the underlying soil and vegetation interactions in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 土壤温度和湿度数据中的模式可以揭示绿洲-沙漠生态系统中土壤与植被之间的相互作用。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Patterns in soil temperature and moisture data can provide insights into the interactions between soil and vegetation, such as water retention capacity, root zone dynamics, and the effects of temperature on vegetation growth. These interactions are crucial for maintaining the ecological stability and productivity of oasis–desert ecosystems.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 土壤温度和湿度数据中的模式可以提供土壤与植被之间相互作用的见解，例如水分保持能力、根区动态以及温度对植被生长的影响。这些相互作用对维持绿洲-沙漠生态系统的生态稳定性和生产力至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do the methods of data processing and quality control affect the reliability and usability of meteorological and flux datasets in studying oasis–desert systems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 数据处理和质量控制的方法如何影响在研究绿洲-沙漠系统中气象和通量数据集的可靠性和可用性。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Data processing and quality control methods, such as ensuring data completeness, removing duplicates, and discarding physically unrealistic values, significantly enhance the reliability and usability of datasets. These methods ensure that the data accurately represents the studied phenomena, allowing for more precise modeling and analysis of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis–desert systems.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制方法，如确保数据完整性、去除重复数据和剔除物理上不合理的值，显著提高了数据集的可靠性和可用性。这些方法确保数据准确地代表所研究的现象，从而允许对绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换进行更精确的建模和分析。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the necessity of using both field and remote-sensing observations for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange studies in oasis–desert areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区进行能量、水汽和碳交换研究时，使用现场观测和遥感观测的必要性受到以下因素的影响：
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Extensive studies have shown that understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas requires a combination of field and remote-sensing observations to capture the complex interactions and dynamics within these ecosystems. This approach is critical for achieving goals like carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, as well as supporting ecological stability and sustainable development.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 广泛的研究表明，理解绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换需要结合实地观测和遥感观测，以捕捉这些生态系统内复杂的相互作用和动态。这种方法对于实现碳达峰和碳中和等目标，以及支持生态稳定和可持续发展至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is long-term data collection crucial for understanding the interactions between oasis and desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 长期数据收集对于理解绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用至关重要。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are indispensable for recognizing oasis–desert interactions because they provide quantitative insights into the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes. This understanding is significant for protecting the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases and is necessary to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 长期观察对于识别绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，因为它们提供了对能量、水汽和碳交换过程的定量洞察。这种理解对于保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义，并且对于维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡是必要的。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What challenges are faced in data collection within inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域，数据收集面临哪些挑战？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological degradation challenges, such as drying rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These conditions complicate data collection efforts and impact the accuracy and comprehensiveness of datasets.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态退化的挑战，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些条件使数据收集工作变得复杂，并影响数据集的准确性和全面性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of implementing consistent quality control measures on long-term meteorological data collection in arid and semi-arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区实施一致的质量控制措施对长期气象数据收集的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing consistent quality control measures on long-term meteorological data collection can lead to more accurate and reliable datasets, which are crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. This reliability can support achieving sustainable development goals and ensuring ecological security in these regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 在长期气象数据收集过程中实施一致的质量控制措施，可以导致更准确和可靠的数据集，这对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。这种可靠性可以支持实现可持续发展目标，并确保这些地区的生态安全。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What might be the implications of integrating eddy covariance system data with traditional meteorological observations for carbon cycle studies in arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将涡度协方差系统数据与传统气象观测数据结合在一起，对于干旱地区的碳循环研究可能会产生哪些影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating eddy covariance system data with traditional meteorological observations can enhance carbon cycle studies by offering a comprehensive view of carbon and methane fluxes in oasis–desert systems. This integration allows for a more detailed quantitative understanding of carbon sinks and sources, contributing to carbon balance assessments and informing strategies for carbon neutrality in these regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将涡度协方差系统数据与传统气象观测相结合，可以通过提供对绿洲-沙漠系统中碳和甲烷通量的全面视角，增强碳循环研究。这种整合使我们能够更详细地定量理解碳汇和碳源，有助于碳平衡评估，并为这些地区的碳中和策略提供信息。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives behind establishing automatic weather stations for collecting meteorological data in arid and semi-arid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区建立自动气象站收集气象数据的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to understand the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, which is crucial for achieving sustainable oasis development, carbon peaking, and carbon neutrality in these areas.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，这对于实现这些地区的可持续绿洲发展、碳达峰和碳中和至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis–desert areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区维持对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are essential for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and protecting the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases. They also support ecological security and sustainable development goals.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 长期观察对于识别绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用、保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展至关重要。它们还支持生态安全和可持续发展目标。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are used to ensure data quality and accuracy when collecting meteorological data in complex ecological environments like mixed forest stations?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在复杂生态环境如混合森林站收集气象数据时，确保数据质量和准确性所采用的程序有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data quality and accuracy are ensured by several procedures: ensuring daily 144 data points (every 10 minutes), marking missing data with -6999, removing duplicate records, deleting data that significantly exceed physical meanings or instrument ranges, marking questionable data in red, and standardizing date and time formats.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据质量和准确性通过以下几种程序得以确保：确保每天144个数据点（每10分钟一次），用-6999标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除明显超出物理意义或仪器范围的数据，用红色标记可疑数据，以及标准化日期和时间格式。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can automatic weather stations be effectively utilized to monitor energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 自动气象站如何有效地用于监测绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳通量。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Automatic weather stations can be used by equipping them with sensors for air temperature, humidity, wind speed and direction, radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles, alongside air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. These stations collect data with a 10-minute average period, and the data is further processed and quality controlled for use in analyzing energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 自动气象站可以通过配备空气温度、湿度、风速和风向、辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面传感器来使用，此外还包括空气压力、降水量和土壤湿度剖面。这些站点以10分钟的平均周期收集数据，数据经过进一步处理和质量控制，以用于分析能量、水蒸气和碳通量。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the recommended steps for implementing data processing and quality control in datasets involving soil temperature and moisture measurements in desert regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在涉及沙漠地区土壤温度和湿度测量的数据集实施数据处理和质量控制的推荐步骤如下：
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data processing involves collecting measurements at various depths (e.g., soil temperature at depths from 0cm to 240cm, soil moisture at depths from 2cm to 240cm) and ensuring data quality through daily checks for completeness, removing duplicates, and deleting outliers. Questionable data is flagged, and data is formatted consistently for date and time. These steps help in maintaining the integrity and usefulness of the datasets.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据处理涉及在不同深度（例如，0cm到240cm的土壤温度，2cm到240cm的土壤湿度）收集测量数据，并通过每日检查完整性、去除重复数据和删除异常值来确保数据质量。可疑数据会被标记，并且日期和时间格式保持一致。这些步骤有助于维护数据集的完整性和实用性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection methods enable the observation of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据收集方法能够观察绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis-desert systems, including half-hourly turbulent flux data acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, as well as hydrometeorological data observed from automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period, enable the observation of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的长期观测数据集，包括通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的半小时湍流通量数据，以及从自动气象站观察到的10分钟平均周期的水文气象数据，使得能量、水蒸气和碳交换的观测成为可能。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the integration of various sensor technologies enable comprehensive meteorological data collection in mixed forest ecosystems of arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 各种传感器技术的集成如何在干旱地区的混合森林生态系统中实现全面的气象数据收集？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of sensors such as air temperature and humidity sensors, barometers, rain gauges, wind speed and direction sensors, radiometers, infrared thermometers, and soil moisture and temperature probes enables comprehensive meteorological data collection by providing diverse data points including air temperature, humidity, pressure, precipitation, wind speed, and soil conditions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 传感器的集成，如空气温度和湿度传感器、气压计、雨量计、风速和风向传感器、辐射计、红外温度计以及土壤湿度和温度探头，使得通过提供多样的数据点（包括空气温度、湿度、气压、降水量、风速和土壤状况）实现全面的气象数据收集成为可能。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in ensuring the quality control of datasets collected from oasis–desert ecosystems over long-term periods?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在确保从绿洲-沙漠生态系统长期收集的数据集的质量控制方面，可能会面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms. These challenges can complicate the quality control process for datasets by introducing variability and potential data gaps over long-term periods.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生。这些挑战可能会通过引入变异性和潜在的数据缺口， complicate 长期数据集的质量控制过程。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to maintain a balance in oasis–desert systems when collecting energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在收集能量、水汽和碳交换数据时，维持绿洲-沙漠系统的平衡是至关重要的。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems is critical to achieve sustainable oasis development. A quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续的绿洲发展至关重要。对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义，并支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is long-term data collection crucial for understanding oasis–desert interactions and supporting sustainable ecological practices?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 长期数据收集对于理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用以及支持可持续生态实践至关重要。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are indispensable for achieving a quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas. This understanding is crucial to recognize oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于实现对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解至关重要。这种理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用具有重要意义，并对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in maintaining long-term observational datasets in remote oasis-desert systems, and how can researchers address these challenges?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在偏远的绿洲-沙漠系统中维护长期观测数据集的潜在挑战有哪些，研究人员可以如何应对这些挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Potential challenges include equipment maintenance, data quality control, and environmental harshness affecting sensor performance. Researchers can address these by implementing robust data processing procedures, regular maintenance schedules, and remote monitoring systems to ensure data integrity and continuity over long periods.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 潜在的挑战包括设备维护、数据质量控制以及环境恶劣对传感器性能的影响。研究人员可以通过实施稳健的数据处理程序、定期维护计划和远程监控系统来解决这些问题，以确保数据的完整性和在长时间内的连续性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways might data collection methods for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas be refined to better support sustainable development goals?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，能源、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集方法可以通过哪些方式进行改进，以更好地支持可持续发展目标？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Data collection methods can be refined by incorporating advanced technologies such as high-resolution satellite imagery and machine learning algorithms to enhance the spatial and temporal resolution of datasets. Additionally, integrating socio-economic data with environmental observations can provide a more holistic approach to sustainable development in oasis-desert areas.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法可以通过引入高分辨率卫星影像和机器学习算法来提高数据集的空间和时间分辨率。此外，将社会经济数据与环境观测相结合，可以为沙漠绿洲地区的可持续发展提供更全面的方法。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods ensure the balance between oasis and desert systems in these regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何确保这些地区绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are indispensable for understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. This includes using datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems with data on energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, supported by hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters to recognize the interactions and protect ecological stability.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。这包括利用来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集，涵盖能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的数据，并辅以水文气象、植被和土壤参数，以识别相互作用并保护生态稳定性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges faced in gathering reliable data in arid and semiarid inland river basins.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域收集可靠数据所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological degradation challenges such as drying rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, land desertification, and dust storms. These challenges necessitate robust data collection methods to track changes and formulate sustainable development strategies.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态退化的挑战，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、土地沙漠化和沙尘暴。这些挑战需要强有力的数据收集方法来跟踪变化并制定可持续发展战略。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how datasets from different stations are combined to provide a comprehensive view of the oasis–desert interactions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解如何将来自不同站点的数据集结合起来，以提供对绿洲与沙漠相互作用的全面视角。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The dataset includes observations from 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations, combining data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange with hydrometeorological data, and vegetation and soil parameters. This comprehensive approach is essential to understand and monitor oasis–desert interactions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 该数据集包括来自11个陆面通量和气象站的观测数据，结合了能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据，以及水文气象数据、植被和土壤参数。这种综合方法对于理解和监测绿洲-沙漠相互作用至关重要。
